intro: Pyrenacantha menyharthii, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed hibiscus, is a shrub native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of red and orange. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
